conclusion: Shadows are formed when an object blocks light. The shape and size of the shadow depend on the shape of the object and the position of the light source.
The length of the shadow is determined by the angle of the light rays relative to the object and the ground.
The light source is currently positioned above the objects, casting shadows behind them.
